result.title: Objective
result.description:
Objective
Reduce vulnerability of coastal communities to the impacts of climate change-induced risks in four upazilas in the coastal districts of Barguna and Patuakhali (Western Region), Bhola (Central Region), Noakhali (Central Region), and Chittagong (Eastern Region)

baseline.comment:
Coastal communities face climate change risks largely due to lack of adaptive capacity
Recent scientific findings project 15% increases in salinity, cyclonic events, and inundation of coastal areas, with up to 35 million people becoming climate refugees from the coastal areas by 2050

target.comment: By the end of the project, over 80%0f households in project communities are able to anticipate climate risks and select the most effective risk reduction options. By the end of the project, at least 75% MoL and MoEF government officials and coastal management planners in target districts are able to identify climate induced risks in coastal areas and are capable of prioritizing planning and implementing effective adaptation measures with the involvement of communities

actual.comment:
Incorporation of additional funding enriched the project outcome in reducing the vulnerability of coastal communities to the impacts of climate change induced risks through additional output activities with additional targets.
The project achieved both original and additional targets. Thus, the project has been able to enhance the resilience of protective ecosystem as well as contributed in reducing vulnerabilities in four upazilas viz. Anwara, Hatiya, Char Fassion and Barguna Sadar upazila.

target.comment: N/A

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Outcome 1 Enhanced Resilience of Vulnerable Coastal Communities and Protective Systems to Climate Risks

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Percentage of satisfactory performance of the afforestation (plantation survival and growth) and livelihood measures (increased food security, incomes and income diversification) of the project beneficiaries (per RTPP)

baseline.comment:
Pre-project status of coastal landscapes being treated, and food/income status of project beneficiary households being assisted with livelihoods development (as drawn from the Participatory Assessments and Site Management Plan).
*To be noted that the changes in baseline and target at outcome level as per MTE (Mid Term Evaluation) have been incorporated in the revised and approved project document.

target.comment:
90% of the afforestation areas are assessed as effective and sustainable in post-plantation surveys
80% of the households participating in the project have increased food security and income to adapt to climate risks.
*As per MTE.

actual.comment:
Development objective in reducing the vulnerability of coastal communities has been achieved completely.
>100% of the households participating in the project have increased their coping ability to the impacts of climate induced risks well as resilience of protective ecosystems enhanced through implementing 100% of plantation targets.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Outcome 2 Climate Risk Reduction Measures Incorporated into Coastal Area Management Frameworks

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Percentage of unions, upazillas and districts in the project sites that have identified risk pertaining to CC and prepared strategy and action plans through participatory process to address the risks.

baseline.comment: No mechanisms and budgets available to local authorities to address climate change risks.* As per MTE

target.comment:
75% of local authorities in the project sites have adopted or strengthened plans and strategies to address climate change
50% of the local authorities are implementing afforestation and livelihood support measures in the inundation zone (between coastal forest and embankment)

actual.comment: > 90% of local authorities at union, upazila and district level in the project sites have adopted or strengthened plans and strategies to address CC risks and more than 80% of local authorities are able to identify climate risks and implement adaptation strategies and action plans through participatory process.

target.comment: N/A

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: Outcome 3 National Policies Revised to Increase Climate Risk Resilience of Coastal Communities

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Specific policies have been adopted in support of the projectâ€™s adaptation measures.( It was incorporated as per Mid-Term Evaluation Report, pl. see p.40 of MTR

baseline.comment: Currently there is a national coastal management policy and land use policy, in addition to several others that affect coastal development; however, they do not address climate change and adaptation issues in an integrated manner

target.comment: Policies are adopted to support designation of land for community-based reclamation, model plantation practices and the implementation of co-management processes. * As per MTE

actual.comment: With a view to incorporate climate risk resilience issues in the national policies, the project team developed climate resilient policy recommendations for National Forest Policy (1994); National Land Use Policy ( 2001); National Coastal Zone Management Policy ( 2005) & National Environment Policy ( 1992) through gap analysis of existing policies which are highly relevant to the management of coastal Bangladesh in an integrated manner. Landless communities are now empowered with land ownership rights by accessing government lands.

target.comment: N/A

result.title: Outcome 4
result.description: Outcome 4 Learning, Evaluation, and Adaptive Management Enhanced

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Number of proposals, papers, and other documents that incorporate learning from the project

baseline.comment: Development projects currently do not systematically benefit from learning practices and project lessons on community-based adaptation.

target.comment:
Adaptation measures piloted by the project are consistently modified and/or further improved, based on project experiences
All of the local authorities in the vicinity of the project sites have implemented some of the piloted adaptation measures outside of the project sites. * As per MTE

actual.comment: The project published 10 knowledge products; 17 Training Manuals, 2 Brochures and 7 Leaflets/Fact Sheets. More (5-10 nos.) scientific publications are also expected from Khulna University and Science & Technology University of Patuakhali, Bangladesh. The project prepared 4 documentary films. Project achievements highlighted both nationally and internationally and got wide electronic media coverage (6 coverage) in different TV channels and 7 national as well as 5 international print media coverage. Apart from this, 9 GOB officials participated in one international conference held in Malaysia and 11 participated in one (study tour to Laos, In addition, 16 participants took part in different conferences and workshops, held at Dhaka. Besides, 2 National Dialogues and 33 Lesson Sharing Dialogues at sub-national level with the participation of 457 GOB officials are also important learning components of the project (Please see the List of Activities of CBACC-CF project in Communicating part of this PIR). The exposure visits and lesson sharing dialogues contributed to the adaptation measures piloted by the project, which are consistently improved and modified. It is expected that these modified and improved adaptation measures will get large scale implementation in the follow up project to be implemented in 9 more coastal sites, for which the prodoc has already been signed by the UNDP and Economic Relations Division of Ministry of Planning, Bangladesh.

target.comment: N/A

result.title: Objective
result.description: GOAL: Reduction of the growth of GHG emissions from the brick making industry (BMI) in Bangladesh.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: CO2 emissions reductions (direct) from 16 EEK demonstration projects

baseline.comment: No emission reduction activities form BMI (0 Ktonnes)

target.comment: CO2 emission reduction by 314 Ktonnes by end of the project

actual.comment: 18 kt CO2

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Cummulative energy savings from HHKs in terajoules (TJ) or Ktonnes of coal

baseline.comment: No energy saving activates from BMI (0.0 TJ or 0 Ktonnes)

target.comment: Energy saving from brick kilns about 3326 TJ of 130 Ktonnes of coal

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Percent bricks (including expected replications) produced in Bangladesh are from HHKs

baseline.comment: No bricks from HHKs (0.0%)

target.comment: About 2.2% of the brick (including expected replications) produced in Bangladesh are from HHKs

actual.comment: 260.71 million

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Percentage reduction of average energy cost per unit bricks in the BMI

baseline.comment: No reduction of energy cost of per unit brick (0% )

target.comment: Average energy cost per unit brick in the BMI is reduced by 1.2% by end of the project

actual.comment: Data collection is in progress.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Comparative study on competing technologies on brick making in Bangladesh

baseline.comment: One study conducted in 2006 by the Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology

target.comment: At least one study completed by EOP

actual.comment: 1 Study has been completed and another 1 is in progress.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Clay resources assessed and sources identified for each HHK demos

baseline.comment: No clay resouces assessment have been conducted

target.comment: 15 clay resource assessment by EOP

actual.comment: 11 Clay resources assessments have been completed.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Annual operating performance of each HHK demo project

baseline.comment: No performance study conducted earlier

target.comment: 15 performance evaluations by EOP

actual.comment: 3 Performance evaluation studies have been completed.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Improvement in the overall specific energy consumption in the BMI by EOP

baseline.comment: 0% improvement

target.comment: About 1.2% improvement by EOP

actual.comment: N/A

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: BMI energy reporting system (format) developed and used to report on energy performance of each demo projects

baseline.comment: 1 energy reporting system developed on PDF-B phase

target.comment: 1 energy reporting system (format) and 5 yearly performances report will be developed by EOP

actual.comment: 2 BERM report have been completed (Another one will be developed in last quarter).

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: Database development on light engineering and consultancy services in the vicinity of each HHK demos

baseline.comment: No database development or survey conducted

target.comment: 15 survey reports mentioning data/information on light engineering and consultancy service will be developed by EOP

actual.comment: Database on light engineering and consultancy services have been developed based on 13 HHK demo plants.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Establish full scale demonestration projects by EOP

baseline.comment: 1 HHK demo project in PDF B phase

target.comment: 15 HHK demonstration project established by EOP

actual.comment: 5 HHK demo plants have been established.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Consultation with potential entrepreneurs for promoting HHK demo projects

baseline.comment: No promotional consultation conducted earlier

target.comment: Consultation with at least 100 entrepreneurs by EOP

actual.comment: Consultations have been conducted with a total of 134 interested entrepreneurs.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Conduct technical feasibility study on each HHK demo project

baseline.comment: No feasibility study on HHK demo project conducted in previous

target.comment: 15 feasibility study report by EOP

actual.comment: Total 11 feasibility studies have been completed.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Study conducted on implementation requirements; reports prepared based on each HHK demo project

baseline.comment: No implementation requirements for establishing HHK demo projects

target.comment: 15 reports on implementation requirements for establishing HHK demos by EOP

actual.comment: Total 13 implementation requirements have been prepared.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Baseline studies covering brick production; coal consumption and socio-economic situation

baseline.comment: An overall baseline study conducted during 2006

target.comment: 15 Baseline studies and reports by EOP

actual.comment: Total 12 baseline studies have been completed.

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: Designs package for each HHK

baseline.comment: 1 design package prepared for PDF B phase

target.comment: 15 design package by EOP

actual.comment: Total 11 design packages have been prepared.

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: Financial closure for each proposed demo project

baseline.comment: 1 financial closure in PDF - B phase

target.comment: 15 financial closures by EOP

actual.comment: 11 financial closures for proposed HHK demo projects have been prepared and submitted to the clients.

indicator.title: Indicator 8
indicator.description: Evaluation of demonstration project results

baseline.comment: No evaluation study conducted

target.comment: 15 HHK evaluation reports by EOP

actual.comment: 3 Evaluation report have been prepared.

indicator.title: Indicator 9
indicator.description: Conduct result sharing and dissemination workshop

target.comment: 4 workshop by EOP with a minium participation of 200 people

actual.comment: 1 result sharing workshop have been conducted.

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: Component 3: EEK Technical and Management Capacity Building Program

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Production personnel trained and certified in vocational aspects

baseline.comment: Majority of the workers of BMI industries are seasonal workers and have only skills in traditional brick making

target.comment: Around 500 production personnel trained and certified by EOP

actual.comment: 259 production personnel have been trained. Another 50 is in progress.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Conduct assessment on capabilities of light engineering services within nearest urban centers of demo project

baseline.comment: No assessment study conducted

target.comment: 15 reports on assessment by EOP

actual.comment: 13 assessment reports have been prepared.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Advisory discussions for strengthening local engineering services based on HHK demos (nearest urban area)

baseline.comment: No advisory activities conducted

target.comment: 30 advisory discussions by EOP

actual.comment: Advisory discussion have been conducted based on 13 proposed HHK demo plants.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Conduct feasibility Study on the Standardization of Brick Kilns and Associated Equipments

baseline.comment: No feasibility study conducted

target.comment: 3 studies conducted by EOP

actual.comment: 3 Feasibility studies have been completed.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Conduct training Course on the Design, Feasibility Evaluation, Construction, Operation and Maintenance of HHKs

baseline.comment: Plant personnel have little or no managerial or business skills.

target.comment: 100 trainees certified by EOP

actual.comment: Not in plan within reporting period. The project so far has trained 70 personnel.

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: Technical assistance provided to entrepreneurs to plan HHKs

baseline.comment: No assistance provided

target.comment: Technical assistance to 30 enterpreneurs by EOP

actual.comment: Technical Assistance provided to 22 entrepreneurs.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Develop a business plan on BMI information centre

baseline.comment: There are no information centers on BMI in the country

target.comment: 1 business plan for BMI by EOP

actual.comment: 1 business plan has been prepared.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Develop IKEBMI project brochure

baseline.comment: No brochure on IKEBMI and HHK

target.comment: 5000 brochures by EOP

actual.comment: Total 5000 brochures have been produced and most of them are already distributed.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Prepare video documentary on BMI/IKEBMI/HHK

target.comment: 2 video documentaries by EOP (one for 20-30s min and other for 5-7 mins)

actual.comment: Total 5 video documentaries have been prepared.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Awareness campaign on ECA & PA

baseline.comment: Limited awareness related activities

target.comment: 4 awareness events by EOP

actual.comment: One campaign on ECA & PA has been conducted.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Conduct networking meetings

baseline.comment: Limited networking

target.comment: 2 networking meetings by EOP

actual.comment: N/A

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: Conduct media sensitization

baseline.comment: Limited media awareness on HHK

target.comment: 3 media sensitization events by EOP

actual.comment: 1 Journalist fellowship has been provided.

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: Conduct media tours

baseline.comment: Limited media coverage on HHK

target.comment: 3 media tours by EOP

actual.comment: 3 Media tours have been completed.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Prepare action plan for financing demo project

baseline.comment: Limited ability of banks and other financial institutions to address loan risks and also benefits to finance HHK investment

target.comment: 1 set of action plan by EOP

actual.comment: 1 set of action plan has been prepared.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Conduct techno-economic feasibility studies on potential HHK Demo

baseline.comment: One techno-economic feasibility studies in PDF-B phase

target.comment: 15 techno-economic feasibility studies completed by EOP

actual.comment: Total 11 techno-economic feasibility studies have been completed.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Engagement of financial institutions on HHK Projects

baseline.comment: Little understanding regarding EEK BMI industry

target.comment: 2 discussion meetings conducted with at least 20 participants from 6 institutions by EOP

actual.comment: 67 discussions have been conducted with 13 banks financial institutions.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Promote business links (between entrepreneurs and banks)

baseline.comment: No linkage on financing HHK

target.comment: Business linkage established among at least 15 entrepreneurs and 5 banks- at least one report produced on this by EOP

actual.comment: 1 linkage has been established with a financial institution.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Increasing access to financing sources

baseline.comment: Very limited financial sources

target.comment: Support provided to create green funds

actual.comment: 1 new financial sources has been identified.

result.title: Outcome 6
result.description: Component 6: EEK Policy Development and Institutional Support Program

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Improving GOB awareness on favorable regulatory regimes for BMI

baseline.comment: No efforts by GOB to promote a favorable regulatory regime to encourage EE in BMI

target.comment: 2 seminars with atleast 20 participants each time by EOP

actual.comment: 1 Workshop and 1 visit have been conducted.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Polices and Implementing Rules and Regulations (IRRs)

baseline.comment: There are no new policies to encourage EE practices and technologies and no ongoing efforts to harmonize â€œBrick Burning Actâ€ administrative procedures.

target.comment: Policies drafted by EOP

actual.comment: IRRs have been drafted.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Develop \\\"Brick Quality Standard\\\"

baseline.comment: There are no brick quality standards in Bangladesh

target.comment: Drafting Brick Quality Standards by EOP

actual.comment: A brick quality standard based on dimension, classification, appearance, water absorption, average comprehensive strength, tendency to efflorescence, quality of raw materials has been drafted.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Drafting study on Brick making EE policy and regulation enforcement

baseline.comment: No emission standards for the BMI, limited capacity to enforce regulations

target.comment: Drafting BMI EE policies by EOP

actual.comment: No progress.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Strategies and regulations on minimizing land degradation from BMI activities developed and implemented

baseline.comment: No coordinated efforts to mitigate land degradation due to top soil mining

target.comment: Drafting strategies and regulations by EOP

actual.comment: Strategies have been prepared.

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: Capacity building on EEKs and compliance with Emission Standards

baseline.comment: No emission standards for the BMI, limited capacity to enforce regulations

target.comment: Around 50 persons attend regional workshops on BMI emission standards by EOP

actual.comment: No progress.

location.name: Dhaka
location.activity-description: Development of Sustainable Renewable Energy Power Generation

result.title: Objective
result.description: Reduction in the annual growth rate of GHG emissions from fossil fuel-fired power generation through the exploitation of Bangladesh’s renewable energy resources for power generation

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
Cumulative direct post-project CO2 emission reductions resulting from the RE technical assistance and investments by end-of-project (EOP), Mtons CO2.
% share of RE in the power generation mix of Bangladesh

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: SREDA evolves into a facilitation center to support private sector RE investment development, enable regulators to determine fair flexible tariff structures, bring confidence to private RE investors, and increase the number of approved RE projects

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
Number of on-grid RE projects approved based on studies of improved RE policy and tariffs and RE grid integration and SREDA operational rules
Number of on-grid RE projects facilitated by SREDA operational rules
Number of RE development project proponents that were assisted by SREDA staff in the technical design and approval of their projects

actual.comment:
0
(2 Wind and 5 solar projects have come up based on current policy framework of the govt. but not based on SREPGen project)
0
0

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Increased capacities of relevant government agencies to generate, process, obtain and disseminate reliable RE resource information for use by GoB and potential project developers and investors

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
Number of implemented wind energy projects that were designed based on the wind maps
Number of RE resource assessments and data gathering that were carried out by the private sector
Number of biomass-based power generation projects that were designed based on the biomass resource assessment data

actual.comment:
0
3
[2-wind resource assessments (NREL, and REGen) are ongoing.]
0

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: Increased affordability of photovoltaic solar LED lanterns (PVSLs) for low income households

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
Number of government-certified PVSL models that meet international standards for functionality and durability that are imported into the country
Number of low income households that are able to afford monthly payments from established and operational financial mechanisms for the purchase and use of PVSLs
Number of PVSL supply and delivery chains that also provide product support and credit collection by Year 2
Number of PVSL supply and delivery chains that also provide product support and credit collection by Year 2
Number of PVSLs disseminated to rural households outside of the project by EOP

result.title: Outcome 4
result.description: Renewable energy accounts for an increased share of Bangladesh’s power generation mix

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
Number of RE projects that are financed through RE funds where SREDA has had involvement in operationalization
MW of RE on-grid projects installed by EOP
MW of RE off-grid projects installed by EOP
% increase of RE in Bangladesh’s power generation mix by EOP
MW capacity of RE generation projects (on-grid and off-grid) in planning and design stages by EOP

actual.comment:
0
8.4 (Not with project influence)
172 (at present in B’Desh, but not with project influence)
